meanings.sent1: The newspaper libeled the politician by printing false accusations.
meanings.sent2: She was libeled in the magazine article, causing damage to her reputation.
meanings.sent3: The tabloid libeled the celebrity by spreading lies about their personal life.
meanings.sent4: The author felt libeled when his work was plagiarized without credit.
meanings.sent5: The online post libeled the company, leading to a lawsuit for defamation.

meanings.definition: Accused of wrongdoing in a public manner
meanings.sent1: The libeled individual demanded a public apology for the false accusations.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed being the libeled subject of the gossip at school.
meanings.sent3: The libeled student found humor in the exaggerated rumors about them.
meanings.sent4: The libeled company faced a storm of negative publicity after the scandal broke.
meanings.sent5: The libeled politician struggled to regain trust after the scandalous accusations.
